title: [Medicine] Doctors tend to think differently in networks than they do when they are alone. New study offers striking evidence that network science can be used to remove race and gender bias in clinical settings. Furthermore, the network approach to bias-reduction improved the quality of care for everyone.

[Medicine] "Like punching holes in a belt:" Medications that treat conditions including erectile dysfunction, depression and leukemia are made using specific molecular rings that are often cumbersome and expensive to produce. A new study shows how to tailor-make those rings in a cheaper, easier way.
